title: Definitions
context: [PART XLI.] COMPASSIONATE CARE FOR SEXUAL ASSAULT VICTIMS [ยง321-511] Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context otherwise requires: &ldquo;Compulsion&rdquo; means absence of consent, or a threat, express or implied, that places a person in fear of public humiliation, property damage, or financial loss. &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health unless otherwise specified in this part. &ldquo;Emergency contraception&rdquo; means one or more prescription drugs used separately or in combination that are: (1) Used postcoitally within a recommended amount of time; (2) Used for the purposes of preventing pregnancy; and (3) Approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration. &ldquo;Hospital&rdquo; means any institution with an organized medical staff, regulated under sections 321-11(10) and 321-14.5, that admits patients for inpatient care, diagnosis, observation, and treatment. &ldquo;Sexual assault&rdquo; means vaginal penetration without the person&rsquo;s consent, by compulsion or strong compulsion. &ldquo;Sexual assault victim&rdquo; means a person who alleges or is alleged to have been sexually assaulted and as a result of the sexual assault presents as a patient at a hospital. &ldquo;Strong compulsion&rdquo; means the use of or attempt to use one or more of the following to overcome a person: (1) A threat, express or implied, that places a person in fear of bodily injury to the person or another person, or in fear that the person or another person will be kidnapped; (2) A dangerous instrument; or (3) Physical force. [L 2013, c 27, pt of ยง2]
